Power text: Gain 1 [seed] from the birdfeeder (if available). You may cache it on this card.
Note: The birds with these powers are known for caching extra food and saving it for later. As noted on these cards, you can cache exactly 1 food token when their power is activated by placing it on a bird card. Once a food token is cached on a bird card, you cannot spend it. Each token on the card at the end of the game is worth 1 point. If the same dice are showing in the birdfeeder, you may reroll to see if you meet the condition of the bird. If you run out of food tokens, you can cache cards instead.

Power text: When another player takes the "lay eggs" action, this bird lays 1 [egg] on another bird with a [ground] nest.
Note:
These birds are all nest parasites in the wild: they lay eggs in other birds’ nests. Cowbirds don’t even build their own nests.
When another player uses the [grassland] action to lay eggs, you may lay 1 egg. You may do this only once between your turns, no matter how many other players lay eggs. The cowbird can lay eggs on star nests.

rulings.text: You may not use this bird's power to lay an [egg] on another player's bird.

Power text: Player(s) with the fewest [wetland] birds: draw 1 [card].
Note: If players are tied for the fewest birds currently in the wetland habitat, all draw a card, starting with you and proceeding clockwise. All may draw from the deck or the face-up cards.

Power text: Tuck a [card] from your hand behind this bird. If you do, draw 1 [card].
Note: These birds all allow you to tuck a card from your hand for a point, then gain some additional benefit (lay an egg, draw a card, or gain a food). You can only gain the benefit if you first tuck a card from your hand.

Power text: Discard 1 [egg] from any of your other birds to gain 1 [wild] from the supply.
Note: These birds are all known for eating eggs from other birds’ nests. You must have laid an egg on another bird before you can use these powers. Discard the egg to the supply.

Power text: Gain 3 [seed] from the supply.
Roll all dice not in birdfeeder. If any are [rodent], gain 1 [rodent] and cache it on this card.
Note: Birds that eat rodents or fish roll all dice that are not in the birdfeeder. (Note that you will never roll more than 4 dice, because when all 5 dice are out of the birdfeeder it must reset immediately.) Roll dice on the table; they do not go back into the birdfeeder. If one or more dice show the specified type, take at most 1 token of that type from the supply and cache it on your card (see “Caching food”). Each token on a bird card is worth 1 point at the end of the game.

Power text: Draw [card] equal to the number of players +1. Starting with you and proceeding clockwise, each player selects 1 of those cards and places it in their hand. You keep the extra card.
Note: Draw the cards from the deck so that you have a set with one more card than there are players. Each player chooses one card from this set, starting with you and passing to the left. When everyone has chosen a card, you keep the extra card.

rulings.text: When using this bird's power in a game against the Automa, draw 3 [card], keep 2 of them, and discard the other.
When using this bird's power, you may take the drawn cards from the deck and/or from the bird tray, despite the bird's entry in the Appendix.

Power text: Gain 1 [wild] from the birdfeeder.

rulings.text: This bird's power lets you take 1 food from the birdfeeder, as if [wild] were replaced by [die] in the power text.
This bird does not count toward the Anatomist bonus card.

Power text: Tuck a [card] from your hand behind this bird. If you do, draw 1 [card].
Note: These birds all allow you to tuck a card from your hand for a point, then gain some additional benefit (lay an egg, draw a card, or gain a food). You can only gain the benefit if you first tuck a card from your hand.

Power text: Discard a [fish] to tuck 2 [card] from the deck behind this bird.
Note: These powers allow you to discard a specific type of food to take 2 cards from the deck and tuck them behind the bird. You must have the food in your personal supply; you cannot take it from a bird card.

Power text: Each player gains 1 [die] from the birdfeeder, starting with the player of your choice.
Note: The hummingbird’s owner decides which person gains the first food, and then players gain food in turn order. Players may reset the birdfeeder if it is empty or if all dice are showing the same face.

Power text: Lay 1 [egg] on each of your birds with a [cavity] nest.
Note: This power allows you to lay eggs on all of your birds that have a specific nest symbol (and all birds with a star nest symbol), including the newly played bird.

Power text: Draw 2 new bonus cards and keep 1.
Note:
Draw two goal cards, pick the one you want to keep, and discard the other. If the deck of goal cards is ever exhausted, shuffle the discards to form a new face-down deck.
The birds with this power are all threatened or endangered, or conservationists are concerned that they soon will be because of a declining trend in their population.

Power text: Draw 2 [card] from the deck. Tuck 1 behind this bird and keep the other.

Power text: Look at a [card] from the deck. If <75cm, tuck it behind this bird. If not, discard it.
Note:
These birds eat other birds. Look at the wingspan of the top card of the deck and compare it to their hunting power.
If the wingspan of the top card in the deck is less than the bird’s hunting power, tuck that card to signify that your predator hunted successfully. Each tucked card is worth 1 point at the end of the game.
If the wingspan of the top card is equal to or larger than your predator’s power, discard the card instead.

Power text: When another player plays a [wetland] bird, gain 1 [fish] from the supply.
Note: Activate these powers when a player uses the “Play a bird” action to play a bird into the specific habitat. A bird that uses its power to move into the habitat does not trigger this power.

rulings.text: This bird's power is triggered by another player playing a bird in their [wetland] during their turn, even when not using the "play a bird" card action to do so (instead using, e.g., the Common Moorhen's power), despite this bird's entry in the Appendix.

Power text: If this bird is to the right of all other birds in its habitat, move it to another habitat.
Note: These birds are all able to live in a variety of habitats, and their power is to move from habitat to habitat—but only if they’re the last bird in that row. (They can be in any column.) This can be powerful for increasing your abilities in multiple habitats, and for scoring on end-of-round goals. Be careful not to play another bird to the right of one of these cards, or you won’t be able to use its power!

rulings.text: When using this bird's power to move this bird to another habitat, the action cube stays on the current habitat.

Power text: Choose a habitat with no [egg]. Lay 1 [egg] on each bird in that habitat.

Power text: When another player's predator succeeds, gain 1 [die] from the birdfeeder.

rulings.text: If a bird (e.g., Common Buzzard) is played on top of this one, the top bird is also placed horizontally and occupies both columns.

Power text: Play a second bird in your [forest]. Pay its normal cost.

The birds with this power all are known for spending time in mixed flocks with multiple bird species. Research has shown this can have benefits such as help finding food and being alerted about predators.

rulings.text: If you use this bird's power to play another bird with a "play a second bird" power, you may then use the latter bird's power to play yet another bird.

Power text: All players gain 1 [invertebrate] from the supply.

Power text: Roll all dice not in the birdfeeder. If any are [rodent], place 1 [egg] on this card.

rulings.text: This bird does not count toward the Anatomist bonus card.

Power text: Remove any 1 [die] from the birdfeeder, then gain 1 [seed] from the supply.
Note: You gain a [seed] no matter what food die you removed from the birdfeeder.

Power text: Look at a [card] from the deck. If <100cm, tuck it behind this bird. If not, discard it.
Note:
These birds eat other birds. Look at the wingspan of the top card of the deck and compare it to their hunting power.
If the wingspan of the top card in the deck is less than the bird’s hunting power, tuck that card to signify that your predator hunted successfully. Each tucked card is worth 1 point at the end of the game.
If the wingspan of the top card is equal to or larger than your predator’s power, discard the card instead.

Power text: Draw 2 [card]. If you do, discard 1 [card] from your hand at the end of your turn.
Note: This power adds cards to the wetland’s draw card(s) action, but it has a cost. The next player may start their turn while you are deciding which card(s) to discard.

Power text: All players lay 1 [egg] on any 1 [cavity] bird. You may lay 1 [egg] on 1 additional [cavity] bird.
Note: This power allows you to lay an egg on 1 or 2 birds with a specific nest symbol (or a star). All other players can lay an egg on 1 bird with that nest symbol (or a star), if they have one.

rulings.text: If you use this bird's power to lay 2 [egg], they must be laid on different [cavity]/[star] birds.

Power text: Tuck a [card] from your hand behind this bird. If you do, gain 1 [seed] from the supply.
Note: These birds all allow you to tuck a card from your hand for a point, then gain some additional benefit (lay an egg, draw a card, or gain a food). You can only gain the benefit if you first tuck a card from your hand.

Power text: All players draw 1 [card] from the deck.
Note: Draw clockwise, starting with the current player.

Power text: Tuck a [card] from your hand behind this bird. If you do, draw 1 [card].
Note: These birds all allow you to tuck a card from your hand for a point, then gain some additional benefit (lay an egg, draw a card, or gain a food). You can only gain the benefit if you first tuck a card from your hand.

Power text: Tuck a [card] from your hand behind this bird. If you do, gain 1 [invertebrate] or 1 [seed] from the supply.
Note: These birds all allow you to tuck a card from your hand for a point, then gain some additional benefit (lay an egg, draw a card, or gain a food). You can only gain the benefit if you first tuck a card from your hand.

Power text: All players gain 1 [seed] from the supply.
Instead of paying any costs, you may play this bird on top of another bird on your player mat. Discard any eggs and food from that bird. It becomes a tucked card.
Note:
If you use this power, you pay neither the food cost nor the egg cost for these birds. This counts as both a) tucking a card and b) a predator succeeding, and triggers birds with pink powers accordingly.
Any cards that were tucked behind the original bird remain tucked, but you must discard any eggs.

rulings.text: If this bird is played on top of a horizontal one (e.g., Common Blackbird), it is also placed horizontally and occupies both columns.
In games where the Automa has drawn the Citizen Scientist bonus card, this bird qualifies for that bonus card.
This bird counts toward the Falconer bonus card despite the specification of brown powers in the bonus card's entry in the Appendix.

Power text: Draw 1 new bonus card. Then draw 3 [card] and keep 1 of them.
Note: You may look at the bonus card you drew before doing the second part of these actions.

Power text: Steal 1 [invertebrate] from another player's supply and cache it on this bird. They gain 1 [die] from the birdfeeder.
Note: The food that the other player gains does not have to be the same type stolen.

Power text: Gain 1 [seed] from the birdfeeder (if available). You may cache it on this card.
Note: The birds with these powers are known for caching extra food and saving it for later. As noted on these cards, you can cache exactly 1 food token when their power is activated by placing it on a bird card. Once a food token is cached on a bird card, you cannot spend it. Each token on the card at the end of the game is worth 1 point. If the same dice are showing in the birdfeeder, you may reroll to see if you meet the condition of the bird. If you run out of food tokens, you can cache cards instead.

Power text: Draw 2 [card]. If you do, discard 1 [card] from your hand at the end of your turn.
Gain 1 [seed] from the supply and cache it on this card.
Note: The birds with these powers are known for caching extra food and saving it for later. As noted on these cards, you can cache exactly 1 food token when their power is activated by placing it on a bird card. Once a food token is cached on a bird card, you cannot spend it. Each token on the card at the end of the game is worth 1 point. If the same dice are showing in the birdfeeder, you may reroll to see if you meet the condition of the bird. If you run out of food tokens, you can cache cards instead.

Power text: Draw 2 new bonus cards and keep 1.
Note:
Draw two goal cards, pick the one you want to keep, and discard the other. If the deck of goal cards is ever exhausted, shuffle the discards to form a new face-down deck.
The birds with this power are all threatened or endangered, or conservationists are concerned that they soon will be because of a declining trend in their population.

Power text: Play a second bird in your [forest]. Pay its normal cost.
Note:
Play another bird into the same habitat. You must follow all other rules about how to play birds: it must be a bird that can live in that habitat, and you must discard the food and egg cost for that bird.
The birds with this power all are known for spending time in mixed flocks with multiple bird species. Research has shown this can have benefits such as help finding food and being alerted about predators.

rulings.text: If you use this bird's power to play another bird with a "play a second bird" power, you may then use the latter bird's power to play yet another bird.

Power text: Gain 1 [seed] from the birdfeeder (if available). You may cache it on this card.

Each token on the card at the end of the game is worth 1 point. If the same dice are showing in the birdfeeder, you may reroll to see if you meet the condition of the bird. If you run out of food tokens, you can cache cards instead.

Power text: Lay 1 [egg] on each bird in this column, including this one.
Look at a [card] from the deck. If <75cm, tuck it under this bird. If not, discard it.
Note:

Power text: Tuck a [card] from your hand behind this bird. If you do, also lay 1 [egg] on this bird.
Note: These birds all allow you to tuck a card from your hand for a point, then gain some additional benefit (lay an egg, draw a card, or gain a food). You can only gain the benefit if you first tuck a card from your hand.

rulings.text: If this bird already has the maximum number of [egg] on it, you can still use its power to tuck a [card].

Power text: Tuck a [card] from your hand behind this bird. If you do, draw 1 [card].
Note: These birds all allow you to tuck a card from your hand for a point, then gain some additional benefit (lay an egg, draw a card, or gain a food). You can only gain the benefit if you first tuck a card from your hand.

Power text: Gain 1 [seed] or [fruit] from the birdfeeder, if there is one.

rulings.text: When using this bird's power, if all [die] in the birdfeeder show the same face you may reroll before taking food.

Power text: Draw 2 new bonus cards and keep 1.
Note:
Draw two goal cards, pick the one you want to keep, and discard the other. If the deck of goal cards is ever exhausted, shuffle the discards to form a new face-down deck.
The birds with this power are all threatened or endangered, or conservationists are concerned that they soon will be because of a declining trend in their population.

Power text: Each player gains 1 [die] from the birdfeeder, starting with the player of your choice.
Note: The hummingbird’s owner decides which person gains the first food, and then players gain food in turn order. Players may reset the birdfeeder if it is empty or if all dice are showing the same face.

Power text: Draw 2 [card]. If you do, discard 1 [card] from your hand at the end of your turn.
Note: This power adds cards to the wetland’s draw card(s) action, but it has a cost. The next player may start their turn while you are deciding which card(s) to discard.

Power text: Tuck up to 3 [card] from your hand behind this bird. Draw 1 [card] for each card you tucked.

rulings.text: This bird counts toward the Bird Counter bonus card despite the specification of brown powers in the bonus card's entry in the Appendix.

Power text: Discard 1 [seed] to tuck 2 [card] from the deck behind this bird.
Note: These powers allow you to discard a specific type of food to take 2 cards from the deck and tuck them behind the bird. You must have the food in your personal supply; you cannot take it from a bird card.

Power text: Play a second bird in your [grassland]. Pay its normal cost.
Note:
Play another bird into the same habitat. You must follow all other rules about how to play birds: it must be a bird that can live in that habitat, and you must discard the food and egg cost for that bird.
The birds with this power all are known for spending time in mixed flocks with multiple bird species. Research has shown this can have benefits such as help finding food and being alerted about predators.

rulings.text: If you use this bird's power to play another bird with a "play a second bird" power, you may then use the latter bird's power to play yet another bird.

Power text: Draw 2 [card]. All other players draw 1 [card] from the deck.
Note: You may choose to draw face-up cards or from the deck as normal, but each other player may only draw their card from the deck.

Power text: Lay 1 [egg] on each of your birds with a [bowl] nest.
Note: This power allows you to lay eggs on all of your birds that have a specific nest symbol (and all birds with a star nest symbol), including the newly played bird.

Power text: Lay 1 [egg] on this bird.
All players gain 1 [invertebrate] from the supply.
Discard 1 [egg] from any bird. If you do, play another bird in your [forest]. Pay its normal food and egg cost.
Note: If the additional bird has a “when played” power, it is triggered when the bird is played.

rulings.text: Using this bird's power to play a bird in your [forest] triggers the power of the Eastern Kingbird on another player's player mat, despite the Eastern Kingbird's entry in the Appendix.

Power text: When another player tucks a [card] for any reason, tuck 1 [card] from your hand behind this bird, then draw 1 [card] at the end of their turn.

rulings.text: This bird counts toward the Photographer bonus card.
When using this bird's power, draw the [card] from the bird tray before it is refilled.
This bird counts toward the Bird Counter bonus card despite the specification of brown powers in the bonus card's entry in the Appendix.

Power text: Roll all dice not in birdfeeder. If any are [fish], gain 1 [fish] and cache it on this card.
Note: Birds that eat rodents or fish roll all dice that are not in the birdfeeder. (Note that you will never roll more than 4 dice, because when all 5 dice are out of the birdfeeder it must reset immediately.) Roll dice on the table; they do not go back into the birdfeeder. If one or more dice show the specified type, take at most 1 token of that type from the supply and cache it on your card (see “Caching food”). Each token on a bird card is worth 1 point at the end of the game.

Power text: Draw 1 new bonus card. Then gain 1 [card] or lay 1 [egg] on any bird.
Note: You may look at the bonus card you drew before doing the second part of these actions.

Power text: If this bird is to the right of all other birds in its habitat, move it to another habitat.
Note: These birds are all able to live in a variety of habitats, and their power is to move from habitat to habitat—but only if they’re the last bird in that row. (They can be in any column.) This can be powerful for increasing your abilities in multiple habitats, and for scoring on end-of-round goals. Be careful not to play another bird to the right of one of these cards, or you won’t be able to use its power!

rulings.text: When using this bird's power to move this bird to another habitat, the action cube stays on the current habitat.

Power text: Draw 2 new bonus cards and keep 1.
Note:
Draw two goal cards, pick the one you want to keep, and discard the other. If the deck of goal cards is ever exhausted, shuffle the discards to form a new face-down deck.
The birds with this power are all threatened or endangered, or conservationists are concerned that they soon will be because of a declining trend in their population.

Power text: All players draw 1 [card] from the deck.
Note: Draw clockwise, starting with the current player.

rulings.text: This bird is worth 5 points, not 4. (This misprint was corrected in the third printing, and a corrected card is available in the update pack.)

Power text: Gain 1 [seed] from the supply.
Draw 2 new bonus cards and keep 1.

Note: If no with [card] that habitat is available, do not gain anything.

Power text: When another player's predator succeeds, gain 1 [die] from the birdfeeder.
Note: If multiple players trigger this power at the same time, they gain food in turn order, starting to the left of the active player (the one whose predator succeeded).

Power text: Discard all remaining face-up [card] and refill the tray. If you do, draw 1 of the new face-up [card].
If you used all 4 types of actions this round, play another bird. Pay its normal food and egg cost.
Note: If the additional bird has a “when played” power, it is triggered when the bird is played. If the extra bird has a “round end” power, it is triggered when the bird is played.

rulings.text: If you use this bird's power to play another bird with a teal power, you can resolve that power at any point among your other remaining teal powers.

Power text: Draw 1 [card] for each empty card slot in this row. At the end of your turn, keep 1 and discard the rest.
Note: These cards should be kept separate from the other cards you draw and your bird cards in hand. They cannot be spent during this turn. But to keep the game moving, you can sort through them at the end of your turn and let the next player start their turn.

Power text: Gain 1 [invertebrate] from the supply.
When another player takes the "lay eggs" action, this bird lays 1 [egg] on another bird with a [bowl] nest.
Note:
These birds are all nest parasites in the wild: they lay eggs in other birds’ nests. Cowbirds don’t even build their own nests.
When another player uses the [grassland] action to lay eggs, you may lay 1 egg. You may do this only once between your turns, no matter how many other players lay eggs. The cowbird can lay eggs on star nests.

rulings.text: You may not use this bird's power to lay an [egg] on another player's bird.
